definition: (name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: The coffin was carried by six soldiers walking in lockstep .
sentences.chinese: 灵柩由齐步行进的六名士兵抬着。

sentences.english: The man stepped off in good spirits.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们精神抖擞地齐步走。

sentences.english: Fireworks flash while red hoods march through a field.
sentences.chinese: 烟火闪烁，红袍人齐步前进穿过旷野。

sentences.english: The battalion marched from the barracks to the parade ground.
sentences.chinese: 这个营的士兵列队从营房齐步走向检阅场。

sentences.english: And the saints go marching in.
sentences.chinese: 加伯列吹起号角，圣徒齐步前进。
部队肩并肩地齐步前进。

sentences.english: The soldiers kept in stet in step until they reached the foot of the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 战士们齐步走到山脚下。谁是最大的输家？

definition: to march at parade step/March! (military command)
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
to drill/to exercise/to go outdoors for physical exercise
to stop/to halt/halt!/to hold resolutely (of a view, an aspiration etc)
to be adjusted to uniformity (usually of weights and measures) (idiom)
